data.title: Serena And Venus Williams Worth $1.42 Million Childhood Home Puts Up For Auction ·

data.text:
Serena and Venus have at all times had a strong bond.

23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams a number of instances spoke about her courting with her sisters and how all 3 of her sisters helped her develop into the player and woman she is. Williams was a visitor on The Goat: Serena episode and host Chanda Rubin learn an excerpt from Williams' 2009 autobiography through which she described her bond with her sisters.

"Yetunde was the forgiver with a heart of gold, Isha was the caretaker who looked after all her sisters. Lyndrea was the ever-ready play pal. I'm not sure as how others saw Venus. But to me she was like a benevolent bodyguard," Williams wrote.

Both Serena and Venus have entered their forties but they still work laborious and push each and every other. Serena and Venus have at all times had a powerful bond and that will most probably never alternate. "Venus and I worked so hard. Still to this day we work side by side at practice.

According to TMZ Sports, the childhood home of Serena and Venus Williams in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, is going up for auction in late September. The house has four bedrooms, two-and-a-half bathrooms and two tennis courts on a 10-plus-acre lot and is estimated to be worth approximately $1.42 million.

RELATED: Serena Williams Departs U.S. Open & Her Outrageous Career

The house, which was built in the 1980s, has fallen into disrepair over the years.

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=n2bOlwAuh3I&feature=youtu.be

Serena and Venus Williams lived there with their father, Richard, who helped them learn the game of tennis as they grew older. Their journey was chronicled in the movie King Richard, and they went on to become two of the greatest players in tennis history.

Venus and Serena moved to the house as teenagers after Richard purchased the property, which features two tennis courts on its 10+ acre lot. It's pretty cool. It's the court where "King Richard" trained his daughters.

Their childhood home also had the memories before they became two of the greatest tennis players and athletes that the world has ever seen.

According to the notice of sale, the house will go to "the highest and very best bidder for money.â

According to Vogue, Serena Williams has been the focal point of the tennis international of late in August that she was "evolving away from tennis, toward other things that are important to me."

However, she pointed to Tom Brady's decision to retire and then unretire throughout an look on Good Morning America and instructed her tennis occupation will not be finished.

"I mean, you never know," she said (h/t ESPN ). "I've just been saying that I think Tom Brady started a really cool trend."

The home where a 23-time Grand Slam champion honed her recreation before she became some of the famous tennis gamers in historical past is anticipated to promote for an outstanding sum.
